items.sentence: I thought we had agreed that you would study harder.
Who\'s going to take care of my dog while I\'m gone?
I used to sing professionally, but I don\'t anymore.
I want Tom to keep doing just what he\'s been doing.
I don\'t allow my kids to watch TV on school nights.
I don\'t think Tom was the one who stole my bicycle.
I don\'t think Tom is going to be a problem anymore.
Tom dozed off sitting in the sun on his front porch.
Tom entered the building through an unlocked window.
Tom finished his drink and then ordered another one.
Tom said he didn\'t plan on going back to Australia.
Tom said he hopes Mary won\'t allow John to do that.
Tom and Mary both know it wasn\'t John who did that.
Tom and Mary both know that isn\'t likely to happen.
Is there anyone here who knows someone in Australia?
Tom doesn\'t know the reason why Mary isn\'t coming.
Tom doesn\'t like people who don\'t show up on time.
No matter what happens, Tom always shows up on time.
Nobody can prevent this plan from being carried out.
You\'re not the only one who knows what\'s going on.
Tom thinks the food Mary makes is usually too spicy.
Tom tried on a shirt he liked, but it was too small.
Tom wanted to stay in Boston for another three days.
Tom was caught red-handed in an FBI sting operation.
Tom was killed in an automobile accident last night.
Tom was sound asleep when Mary walked into the room.
Tom didn\'t have any idea what had happened to Mary.
She had no difficulty in learning the poem by heart.
She has been busy preparing for her trip to the USA.
Since my mother was sick, I stayed home from school.
I don\'t think that I deserved the punishment I got.
I don\'t think this is the best time to talk to Tom.
I fell in love with someone my parents didn\'t like.
It wasn\'t until this morning that Tom told me that.
Tom has a pretty good idea why Mary isn\'t here now.
Tom asked Mary if she knew when the concert started.
Tom asked Mary if she was planning to buy a new car.
Tom is married, has three kids, and lives in Boston.
Tom is practicing his speech in front of the mirror.
Tom is the only Canadian living in our neighborhood.
Tom knew Mary told John to ask Alice not to do that.
Tom continued working even though he was very tired.
Tom decided that it would be fun to try paragliding.
Tom asked Mary to help him with his science project.
Tom cut off a piece of meat and put it on his plate.
When was the last time you ate a home-cooked dinner?
I\'m tired of watching TV. Let\'s do something else.
I\'m very thankful for all that you\'ve done for me.
If you hadn\'t had my advice, you would have failed.
Tom has decided not to do anything about the matter.
